meanings.definition: To crowd around or attack in a group.
meanings.sent1: The excited fans mobbed the singer after the concert.
meanings.sent2: The protesters mobbed the entrance of the government building.
meanings.sent3: The students mobbed the cafeteria when they heard there was free pizza.
meanings.sent4: The paparazzi mobbed the celebrity like a swarm of bees.
meanings.sent5: The zombies mobbed the survivors in the horror movie, creating chaos.

meanings.definition: To overwhelm or surround in a disorderly manner.
meanings.sent1: The news of the sale mobbed the store with eager shoppers.
meanings.sent2: The dark clouds mobbed the sky before the storm.
meanings.sent3: The kids mobbed the playground equipment, causing a playful commotion.
meanings.sent4: The thoughts of failure mobbed his mind like a relentless storm.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly baked cookies mobbed the kitchen, tempting everyone inside.
